text:
Halle Berry is an American actress and former beauty pageant contestant. She was born on August 14, 1966, in Cleveland, Ohio. Berry's parents, Judith and Jerome Berry, were both African-American. She grew up in a lower-income household and was raised by her mother after her parents divorced when she was a child.

Berry began her career in the entertainment industry at a young age, starting as a beauty pageant contestant. She was crowned Miss Teen All-American in 1985 and went on to compete in the Miss USA pageant in 1986. She was also a contestant in the 1986 Miss World pageant.

Berry's acting career began in the early 1990s, with small roles in films and television shows. Her breakthrough role came in 1991 with the film "Jungle Fever," directed by Spike Lee. She gained wider recognition for her roles in the films "Boomerang" (1992), "The Flintstones" (1994), and "Waiting to Exhale" (1995).

In 2001, Berry made history by becoming the first and only woman of African American descent to win the Academy Award for Best Actress, for her portrayal of Leticia Musgrove in "Monster's Ball." She received widespread critical acclaim for her performance and won numerous awards, including the Golden Globe Award for Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Drama.

Berry has continued to have a successful acting career, starring in films such as "X-Men" (2000), "Die Another Day" (2002), "Swordfish" (2001), and "Cloud Atlas" (2012). She has also produced several films and television shows, including the Emmy Award-winning series "Extant" (2014-2015).

Throughout her career, Berry has been recognized for her philanthropic work, particularly in the areas of children's health, education, and women's empowerment. She has been named one of the most beautiful people in the world by People magazine and has been recognized with numerous awards and honors for her contributions to the entertainment industry.

Berry has been married twice, first to musician David Justice from 1993 to 1997, and then to actor Olivier Martinez from 2013 to 2016. She has two children, a daughter named Nahla and a son named Maceo.
